TextBody:

We will need to schedule a remote session to perform a disk cleanup via the backend of your EPP Server appliance.  Can we schedule a remote session for tomorrow at 1:30 PM IST?



Kind regards

TextBody:
ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000IFBon:ref

Hello,



Now there is no space issue. But we want to apply a setting in which we need only 1 year logs and wanted older logs to be deleted.



Regards,

Komal


--------- Original Message ---------

Sender : Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com>

Date : 2024-11-19 13:53 (GMT+5:30)

Title : RE: 00426863 - Disk Space Issue


Hello Komal,

I wanted to check in regarding your support ticket 00426863. We haven’t heard from you in a while, and I just wanted to see if you still need assistance with this issue.

If you’re still experiencing problems or have any updates to share, please let me know. If the issue has been resolved, I can go ahead and close the ticket on my end.

Please feel free to reply to this email with any updates or questions. We’re here to help you get the most out of your Netwrix products.

Ticket Number: 00426863
Ticket Subject: Disk Space Issue
Ticket Details: We are getting below error.
Your appliance is running low on disk space, there is 49.68 gb free available from 257.28 gb (19%). EPP Server functionality and performance may be severely affected. Use Audit Log Backup to reduce the logs stored in the database, delete older system and audit log backups, and tune policies to reduce incoming log count. For further assistance contact Support.

Thank you!

Andre Le Roux
Technical Support Engineer
____________________ _________
Cybersecurity That Works for You

6160 Warren Parkway, Suite 100, Frisco, TX 75034
www.netwrix.com

ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0IFBon:ref
Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #426863 - ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000IFBon:ref - (2) 00426863 - Disk Space Issue

TextBody:
Hi Komal,

Thank you for your response.  In order to delete event logs older than 1 year you will need to schedule an Audit Log Backup under "System Maintenance" > "Audit Log Backup".

See below the configuration which may be efficient for you.  You will need to select how often you would like the audit log backup to run.  Once the backup is completed it will be available to download at the bottom of the "Audit Log Backup" page.  Alternatively you can choose to automatically store the backups on an external shared location (network shared folder).  To do  this you will need to configure and map a shared location under "System Maintenance" > " External Storage", see the second screenshot below.








I hope this information helps, if you have any follow up questions then please do let us know.



Kind regards
__________________
André Le Roux | Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
www.endpointprotector.com

This Email may contain confidential information. Not to be disclosed to third parties without prior written approval.
